FuncDef:
The ds-lite instance command creates a DS-Lite instance and displays the DS-Lite instance view.
The undo ds-lite instance command deletes a DS-Lite instance.
By default, no DS-Lite instance is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a DS-Lite instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the ID of a DS-Lite instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4095.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A DS-Lite instance is a platform for NAT64 attribute configuration. The NAT64 attributes that can be configured include a DS-Lite address pool, DS-Lite ALG, and a limit on the maximum number of DS-Lite sessions. For user traffic assigned to a DS-Lite instance, DS-Lite operations are performed based on DS-Lite attributes configured for the DS-Lite instance.
Follow-up Procedure
Bind a DS-Lite instance to a service board and create a DS-Lite tunnel and a DS-Lite address pool. Run the display ds-lite instance command to view the configuration of an existing DS-Lite instance.
